Package com.vmpconsulting.training.demo

Class Person

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vmpconsulting.training.demo.Person
  • public class Person
extends Object
    This is the base class from which we'll gradually move from Procedural Language like code to implementing the OOPS based code... Right now, it has just two attributes, and we'll keep every access modifier, for the class, attributes and for it's methods as public to keep things simple to get started with...

    Following are the two attributes of this class... 

        1.  Name -  Holds the name of the person, a parameter of type String
     
        2.  Age  -  Holds the age of the given person, a parameter of type Integer
    See Also:
    String, Integer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Person

        public Person​(String pName,
              Integer pAge)
        The Constructor with public access (which means, any code interested in accessing this constructor, could do so, with no inhibitions at all...

        Note that, it is good practice to name all the parameters for the Member-functions and for the Constructors, prefixing with p followed by the name of the attribute in camelCase... The prescribed standards, if adopted, religiously, would make the code looking professional and in fact, it is a very good first step to get started with, adhereing to the prescribed coding standards...

        Do note that, though this Constructor, construts an Object of type Person it does not make an explicit return since, this is a constructor and the defintion also does not explicitly mentions a return type, which is a must in case of Member-functions...

        Parameters:
        pName - - The Name of the person
        pAge - - The Age of the person
